text: - Anyone considering an internship at AWS,
I would say definitely apply.

- I would definitely describe
it as very like hands on,
helpful, everyone's jumping in.
- In a very short period of time
you will learn a bunch of stuff.

- You don't have to
have it all figured out.

You're taught everything
that you need to know.

- I get to work on things that
go straight to the customer

and I get to see the impact
that my projects have.

- And whatever you're into,
you can really find a way to
get connected to that

and find people that are
also interested in it.
(upbeat music)

- I think that Amazon
does such a great job
of pairing us with our manager.
- I get to talk to my managers
and we get to work on things together.

- I'm able to reach out
to my mentors and managers

who are able to not directly
give me the solution,
but guide me to the solution.
- You have all the resources
that have as many mentors as you want.
(upbeat music)
- The culture here at AWS is pretty chill.

- People are very friendly
here and very welcoming.
- There's such a variety of people,
whether it's the way you think,
your backgrounds, even what major you are,
- And when it comes to inclusion,
I feel like Amazon's done a good job
of not only talking about it,
but also actually promoting it.

- I've met people of all
different races, backgrounds,
different identities.
- It's been the best summer
and I've met such amazing people.

- Once you're here, just
believing that you can do it
and trying every day.

It's going to be the most
valuable thing for you.
- This is a once in a lifetime opportunity
- Here, you can go anywhere.
- Here, you can go anywhere.
- (together) Here, you can go anywhere.
Are we supposed to do a thumbs up?
Are we supposed to do that?
(upbeat music)
